str2: Of Hebrew origin; Joannes, the name of four Israelites.

parse: Verb - Imperfect Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: I am, exist. The first person singular present indicative; a prolonged form of a primary and defective verb; I exist.

parse: Verb - Perfect Participle Middle - Nominative Masculine Singular
str2: To put on, clothe (another). From en and duno; to invest with clothing.
A camel or dromedary. Of Hebrew origin; a 'camel'.
Hair (of the head or of animals). Genitive case trichos, etc. of uncertain derivation; hair.
Made of hide, leathern. From derma; made of hide.
Probably akin to the base of zugos; a belt; by implication, a pocket.
From the base of peran; properly, through, i.e. Around; figuratively with respect to; used in various applications, of place, cause or time.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Genitive Masculine 3rd Person Singular
str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.
The loins. Of uncertain affinity; the loin, i.e. The hip; internally procreative power.

parse: Verb - Present Participle Active - Nominative Masculine Singular
str2: Strengthened for a primary edo; used only in certain tenses, the rest being supplied by phago; to eat.
A locust. Apparently from the same as akron; a locust.
Wild, fierce. From agros; wild, literally or figuratively.
Honey. Apparently a primary word; honey.
